messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 1644
messages.msgSnippet: ... Can you cite sources that talk about the real medical ... possible ... all.  And ... risky. ... If you really are interested, you can check here:
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "Julie Stauffer" <jnjstau@g...> wrote:
Can you cite sources that talk about the "real" medical
> underpinnings of learning disorders, that rule out anxiety as
possible
> cause? The brain and neurology are not very well understood at
all. And
> taking posts about "real" dyslexia at face value is tremendously
risky.
>
> Julie
If you really are interested, you can check here:

http://www.interdys.org/research.stm

Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1644
messages.msgSnippet: No I m not.  Don t claim to be.  Never said I was. Yes you have put in nice medical terminology that people have
messages.messageBody:
<<resident expert on learning disabilities>>

No I'm not. Don't claim to be. Never said I was.

Yes you have put in nice medical terminology that people have difficulty
reading and possibly in other skills associated with reading. Now, that is
a nice theory. Can you cite sources that talk about the "real" medical
underpinnings of learning disorders, that rule out anxiety as possible
cause? The brain and neurology are not very well understood at all. And
taking posts about "real" dyslexia at face value is tremendously risky.

Julie
